intro: Bulbostylis pallescens, commonly known as the pale-flowered bulbostylis, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family, commonly known as the sedge family. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences that produce tiny, pale-colored flowers. This species is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries such as Kenya and Tanzania. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Bulbostylis pallescens is often found in nutrient-rich soils and is adapted to thrive in humid, tropical climates.
